overview: The artist keeps on skating on a piece of glass mirror – a one-meter square – that is located at the heart of a construction site. Her gentle movement is threatened by the glass breaking and collisions with the noises from heavy construction equipment around her. The work is charged with tension between colors – brown, white, and transparent; between dimensions – up and down; between delicacy and roughness, and between gentle motion and clumsy movement. “What I find I am contesting against is nothing beyond me, but me and myself.” – HJ
title: Ice Skate
